src:
Palmer u Prištini: Normalizacija odnosa Kosova i Srbije američki prioritet

01 Nov 2019, 16:10

Zamenik pomoćnika američkog državnog sekretara i specijalni izaslanik za zapadni Balkan Metju Palmer je danas u Prištini izjavio da normalizacija odnosa Kosova i Srbije ostaje prioritet SAD. Govoreći predstavnicima studenata i civilnog društva on je rekao da njegova nominacija za izaslanika za Zapadni Balkan naglašava da su SAD tu da pomognu, a Kosovo ne može biti izostavljeno iz rešenja."Kosovo ne može ostati izolovano. Rešenje jednom zauvek odnosa Kosova i Srbije ostaje prioritet", rekao je Palmer u Nacionalnoj biblioteci u Prištini.Takodje je rekao da su 6. oktobra gradjani Kosova glasali za promenu i da su SAD to podržale."Oči sveta videće šta će raditi nova vlada. Ne vidimo nikakvu mogućnost za budućnost Kosova bez normalizacije odnosa sa Srbijom", rekao je on.Dodao je da SAD neće nametati nikakav sporazum bez pristanka obe strane i bez odobrenja u parlamentima i podvukao je da Srbija neće moći da se pridruži EU bez normalizacije odnosa s Kosovom.Rekao je da čim se postigne dogovor Kosova i Srbije, stvari će krenuti dalje.Rekao je da se s budućim premijerom Kosova, Aljbinom Kurtijem susreo pre dva dana u Skoplju."Moje očekivanje od gospodina Kurtija, pod pretpostavkom da će postati premijer, je da će on biti dobar partner SAD-a, da će blisko saradjivati sa nama u ostvarenju zajedničkih ciljeva. Shvatiće da je dijalog važan ne samo za Kosovo već i za SAD. Takodje će naći način da se vrati za pregovarački sto (sa Srbijom), uključujući i rešavanje pitanja carina koje je postalo prepreka", rekao je Palmer. Palmer se danas u Prištini sastao s predsednikom Kosova Hašimom Tačijem i liderima DSK, Isom Mustafom i DPK, Kadrijem Veseljijem.
text:
Palmer in Pristina: Normalizing Kosovo-Serbia relations is an American priority

01 Nov 2019, 15:10

US Deputy Assistant Secretary of State and Western Balkans Special Envoy Matthew Palmer said in Pristina today that normalizing Kosovo-Serbia relations remains a US priority. Speaking to students and civil society representatives, he said his nomination for the Western Balkans envoy stresses that the United States is there to help, and Kosovo cannot be left out of the solution. "Kosovo cannot remain isolated. "Palmer said at the National Library in Pristina. He also said that on October 6, Kosovo's citizens voted in favor of the change and that the US supported it." The eyes of the world will see what the new government will do. We see no opportunity for Kosovo's future without normalization. He added that the US would not impose any agreement without the consent of both parties and without parliamentary approval, and stressed that Serbia would not be able to join the EU without normalizing relations with Kosovo.He said that as soon as an agreement was reached. Kosovo and Serbia, things will move on. He said that he met with the future prime minister of Kosovo, Albin Kurti, two days ago in Skopje. "My expectation from Mr. The assumption that he will become Prime Minister is that he will be a good partner of the United States, that he will work closely with us to achieve our common goals. They will understand that dialogue is important not only for Kosovo but also for the USA. It will also find a way to get back to the negotiating table (with Serbia), including resolving customs issues that have become an obstacle, "Palmer said. Palmer met today with Kosovo President Hashim Thaci and DSK leaders Iso Mustafa and the DPK. Kadri Veseli.
